Data.name: Sapporo
Data.description: Probably best known for its eponymous beer, Sapporo—the capital of Hokkaido, Japan’s northernmost island—has maintained the youthful and open atmosphere of the 1972 Olympic Winter Games, drawing international visitors for its annual Snow Festival and its world-famous ramen. Those seeking out the full diversity of Japanese cuisine will want to visit:  a city with a ramen-inspired theme park is one that embraces and pampers foodies.

pois.name: Mt. Moiwa
pois.description: Typical night view enjoyment spot in Sapporo authorized by "the Japanese new three big night view" in October, 2015. To the extent the night view which can look a ropeway and a MORISU car (mini cable car) around 360 deg from a mountain top observatory of the altitude 531m which takes and arrives is also called "northern jewelry box", that it shines, when I'm shining also it's fine for the daytime as well as the night view, a far place as well as Sapporo-shi district can even look Shokanbetsu chain of mountains and Ishikari bay around. It's possible to go up summertime by car in Moiwayama sightseeing motorway (charge) to the Mid station, and it's possible to enjoy about 3.5 kilometers of freeway (A winter season closes.) At the Mid station, Mt. MOIWA, there is a stand where I get a large selection of original products of the mascot character "MORISU", and a takeout section is also next to the planetarium, the casual French restaurant where you can have a meal while enjoying the scenery "THE JEWELS" and the restaurant at the mountain top station, and it's also enriched in the facilities. It's barrier free full equipment in order to have many people enjoy in the facilities again, and a guide announcement in a ropeway MORISU car stop is also doing correspondence of English, Chinese and Korean.
pois.category: Attraction > Sights & Landmarks > Nature & Parks > Mountains > Lookouts

pois.name: Moerenuma Park
pois.description: Moerenuma Park is a landscape sculpture Mecca designed by Isamu Noguchi offering distinctive expressions of the four seasons Moerenuma Park is designed by sculpture artist Isamu Noguchi as a work of sculpture art in itself. The park was reborn from a waste disposal site and transformed into an art park representative of Sapporo over a period of 23 years. The grand scale of this project earned it the name “landscape sculpture.” Visitors can enjoy different scenery depending on the time of the day and season. Instead of picturing yourself in a park, you should probably think of yourself as being inside a huge sculpture piece.
pois.category: Attraction > Nature & Parks > Bodies of Water > Parks

pois.name: Historical Village of Hokkaido (Kaitaku-no Mura)
pois.description: Nearly every kind of private and public building, from farmhouse to sleigh factory, is on display in this fascinating open-air museum.
pois.category: Attraction > Museums > History Museums

pois.name: Susukino
pois.description: One of Japan’s most famous entertainment districts, Susukino is teeming with noodle restaurants, clubs, shops and pachinko parlors. Pachinko is a cross between pinball and slot machines.
pois.category: Attraction > Sights & Landmarks > Other > Neighborhoods

pois.name: Odori Park
pois.description: Popular year round, Sapporo’s central park offers twelve blocks of tree-lined walkways and open space for recreation and relaxation.

pois.name: Maruyama Park
pois.category: Attraction > Nature & Parks > Parks

pois.name: Sapporo Snow Festival
pois.description: The Sapporo Snow Festival happens in early February each year, transforming the town of Sapporo into a unforgettable winter wonderland of snow and ice sculptures, skating rinks, giant snow slides, zip lines, snow domes and ice bars, and night time illuminations, all presided over by of course, the Ice Queen! There's a myriad of sculptures to see and events to enjoy across three sites in Sapporo and it's not surprising that this event is internationally renowned for its scale, variety, and sheer amount of fun available for all visitors.
pois.category: Attraction > Events > Cultural Events

pois.name: Maruyama Zoo
pois.description: An amusement park and penguin pool make this zoo a popular spot for children.
pois.category: Attraction > Zoos & Aquariums > Nature & Parks > Outdoor Activities > Zoos

pois.name: Sapporo JR Tower Observatory T38
pois.description: JR TOWER Observatory T38 Enjoy the panoramic view of Sapporo City from a height of 160meters,38floors above ground.There is a cafe and souvenir shop that sells original merchandise.
pois.category: Attraction > Sights & Landmarks > Points of Interest & Landmarks > Observation Decks & Towers

pois.name: Fushimi Inari Shrine
pois.description: Sapporo Fushimi Inari Shrine was founded in 1884 by A priest from the Imperial Sapporo shrine. It is a regional Shrine. This location on Sapporo’s Mount Moiwa dates from 1907. The main Fushimi Inari Shrine is in Kyoto. There are 4 deities enshrined. PLEASE BE AWARE THIS IS NOT KYOTO AS MANY PHOTOS HERE DEPICT. (We have tried to fix this problem but TripAdvisor ignores us.)
pois.category: Attraction > Sights & Landmarks > Sacred & Religious Sites

pois.name: Sapporo Beer Museum
pois.description: Sapporo is Japan’s most popular beer; this interactive museum includes a tour and beer-tasting.

pois.name: Sapporo Teine
pois.description: The sapporo-Teine is composed of two-zone. It`s Highland-zone and Olympia-zone. Highland zone for like a intermediate skiers and an advanced skiers. Olympia -zone for a family and like a first- time skiers.
pois.category: Attraction > Nature & Parks > Outdoor Activities > Ski & Snowboard Areas

pois.name: Sapporo TV Tower
pois.description: It is 60 seconds by elevator from the third floor to the observation deck, 90.38 metres above ground. The entirety of Sapporo city unfolds beneath your eyes, set to a background of the magnificent Ishikari countryside, the far afield Japan Sea, and Odori Park, where flowers bloom in the four seasons. Command a panoramic view of the YOSAKOI Soran Festival, Sapporo Snow Festival, and White Illumination.
pois.category: Attraction > Sights & Landmarks > Points of Interest & Landmarks > Lookouts > Observation Decks & Towers
